catentdesc.name: Flex-top Hex Nut
catentdesc.shortdescription: Expanding locknut with a slotted top
catentdesc.longdescription: This nut has a slotted upper section that is bent slightly inward to create friction when joining to a bolt. The result is a durable locking action that resists loosening.

catentdesc.name: Acorn Nut
catentdesc.shortdescription: High-domed cap nut that provides a finished appearance
catentdesc.longdescription: The domed top covers the exposed threads and prevents damage to external parts. Extended dome height and width protects extra long studs. Includes two distorted threads to minimize loosening.

catentdesc.name: Square Nut
catentdesc.shortdescription: Four-sided, internally threaded nut with flat top and bottom
catentdesc.longdescription: Square nuts resist loosening by providing ample surface contact with the object being fastened. Typically used in rail channels to prevent turning. Square sides offer a broad bearing surface for easier wrenching.

catentdesc.name: Wing Nut
catentdesc.shortdescription: Threaded nut with dual wings for manual adjustment
catentdesc.longdescription: This threaded nut features two wings that enable you to tighten the nut by hand. Ideal for applications in which frequent adjustments are necessary. Offers a hex head under the wings to allow for wrench tightening in case the wings break off. Typically used in marine applications.

catentdesc.name: Acme Nut
catentdesc.shortdescription: Specialized lead screw nut with a trapezoidal thread profile
catentdesc.longdescription: This high-performance nut offers a specialized thread, designed for use with Acme screws. Features a 29-degree thread angle, which provides a much larger area of contact between the screw and the nut. Bronze Acme nuts might require lubrication but can handle higher working loads.

catentdesc.name: Tee Nut
catentdesc.shortdescription: Four-pronged wood insert with 2B thread class
catentdesc.longdescription: This nut attaches securely to wood, particle board, or wood-based composite by providing a flange with four serrated-edge prongs. Hammer this nut into a pre-drilled hole. Leaves a flush surface on the exterior side.
